title: How much does Oxford cost for international students? - Quora

response.answer_text: As Ernest aptly points out, tuition ranges from £25,000–35,000/year. Cost of living ranges from £10,000–15,000. So at best, you are looking at £35,000 per year, and at the most, £50,000 per year, or £105,000–150,000 over three years, which converts to $130,000–190,000. That’s a pretty good deal, considering that US universities of comparable quality usually cost approximately $300,000 over four years.
Every programme has its own tuition fees. So you need to check from the website of the programme that you are interested in or contact the admissions office.
